string.text: Wrocław Castle
Skotniki is a village of Kórnik Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Stargarder Castle
Vielist is a village of Preetz Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Gravensteen Castle
Amblève
Amblève is a village of Heeswijk Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Burghausen Castle
Moosthenning is a village of Kufstein Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Anhalt Castle
Langelege is a village of Friedland Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Habsburg Castle
Schönbrunn
Schönbrunn is a village of Niederalfingen Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Budatín Castle
Curovitz is a village of Červený Kameň Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Walkaz is a village of Červený Kameň Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Český Šternberk Castle
Cretes is a village of Bouzov Castle. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Mailan is a village of Bouzov Castle. This district specializes in the harvest of timber which is floated down the river and sold to nearby towns.
Wartburg Castle
Wurzbach is a village of Brake Castle. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Heslinga is a village of Brake Castle. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
Gdańsk
Gdańsk sits on the coast of the halych Sea, at the southern edge of Gdańsk Bay, and nearby the Vistula river.
Lascovic is a village of Gdańsk. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Dargocice is a village of Gdańsk. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Koblyniz is a village of Gdańsk. Villagers here fish for tuna, sardines, bonito, and sharks.
Héverlé
Héverlé is a village of Heeswijk Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Hamburg lies on the Elbe river, which flows into the North Sea.
Eddelak is a village of Hambourg. Villagers make their set out at dawn to catch salmon leaping over the rocks, as well as herring and cod in the sea.
Holthusen is a village of Hambourg. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Lichtenberg is a village of Friedland Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Cöln
Cöln lies on the Rhine river, which flows into the North Sea.
Astonfelde is a village of Cologne. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Postrquino is a village of Kórnik Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Moltberghe is a village of Cologne. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Wien stands at the easternmost extension of the Alps mountains in the Wien Basin, near the Danube river.
Willenruit is a village of Niederalfingen Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Gönyű
Gönyű is a village of Wien. The villagers set nets in the river to catch a variety of fish.
Ahlbeck is a village of Preetz Castle. Villagers make their set out at dawn to catch salmon leaping over the rocks, as well as herring and cod in the sea.
Ybbsitz is a village of Wien. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
Praha lies on the Vltava river in the Prague Plateau.
Lalling is a village of Prague. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Perlesreut is a village of Prague. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Bayerbach is a village of Kufstein Castle. The villagers here make most of their income from the raising of sheep.
Elbogen is a village of Prague. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Straborc lies on the Rhine river, in the Upper Rhine Plain, with the upland areas of the Vosges Mountains to the west and the Black Forest to the east.
Telsperg is a village of Strasbourg. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Dahlem is a village of Strasbourg. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Liberec Castle
Wałbrzych
Wałbrzych is a village of Grodno Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Chrudim is a village of Grodno Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Burgos Castle
Osorno is a village of Castillo de Magaña. The local landowners have established stud farms, supplying horses to cavalry.
Bragança Castle
Bragança
Bragança is a village of Castelo de Monforte. This land is rich in wheat.
Braga is a village of Castelo de Monforte. This land is rich in wheat.
Valongo Castle
Batalha is a village of Castelo de Évora Monte. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Larache Castle
Bayyana is a village of Castillo de Orihuela. Villagers trap rainwater and runoff from the hills to water their fields and their gardens of date palms.
León Castle
Benavente is a village of Castillo de Villapadierna. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Villalazán
Villalazán is a village of Castillo de Villapadierna. The villagers here make most of their income from the raising of sheep.
Badajoz Castle
Arronches is a village of Castillo de Alange. Villagers plant olives here on the hillsides.
Zorita Castle
Nohales is a village of Castillo de Arbeteta. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Huérmeda
Huérmeda de Aragón is a village of Castillo de Arbeteta. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Biniés Castle
Alcoletge is a village of Castillo de Tiebas. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Valencia sits on the west coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in the eastern Iberian Peninsula.
Cocentaina is a village of Valencia. The soil is thin in these parts, but the village does well with hogs and other livestock.
Constantí
Constantí is a village of Valencia. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to towns on the coast.
Almadén
Almadén is a village of Castillo de Alange. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Lisboa lies on the mouth of the Tagus river, in the western portion of the Iberian Peninsula.
Portela is a village of Castelo de Évora Monte. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Caranguejeira is a village of Lisbon. The local landowners have established stud farms, supplying horses to cavalry.
Alcanhões
Alcanhões is a village of Lisbon. This land is rich in wheat.
Reguengo is a village of Lisbon. This land is rich in wheat.

Every realm has a city whose inhabitants are mocked for their provincial unsophistication, and for the Empire that city was Sevilla. One of the first imperial colonies established inland of the Perassic Sea, it served the Empire as a base to subdue the western Palaic tribes. Paravenos was happy to accept the plunder and slaves sent to them from its garrison, but snickered at them behind their backs. That changed when the Jalmaryan general Carsos staged a military coup. When a senator, stymied by his thick accent, nervously asked him to repeat a decree, he unsheathed his sword and said, 'Do you understand this?'
Shalubīnya
Shalubīnya is a village of Castillo de Orihuela. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Arriadh is a village of Sevilla. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Alcolaya is a village of Sevilla. This land is rich in wheat.
Barçalona
Barçalona sits on the west coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in the northeast Iberian Peninsula.
Armentera is a village of Barcelona. The region is known for its production of wheat and barley.
Fontellas is a village of Castillo de Magaña. The low-lying coastline is well-suited to the construction of salt pans.
Vinallop is a village of Barcelona. The low-lying coastline is well-suited to the construction of salt pans.
Coll de Nargó
Coll de Nargó is a village of Barcelona. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Santiago sits in the northwest Iberian Peninsula, near the mountains Serra dos Ancares.
Luarca is a village of Santiago. This land is rich in wheat.
Carneros is a village of Santiago. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Toledo lies on the Tagus river, near the mountains Sistema Central, south of the mountains Sierra de Guadarrama, and southwest of the mountains Sierra de Gredos, in the central Iberia Peninsula.
Torreorgaz is a village of Toledo. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Jaca is a village of Castillo de Tiebas. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
El Frontil
El Frontil is a village of Toledo. This land is rich in wheat.
Membrilla is a village of Toledo. This land is rich in wheat.
Coimbra sits in the eastern Iberian Peninsula, east of the Atlantic Ocean.
Fundão
Fundão is a village of Coimbra. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Miranda do Corvo
Miranda do Corvo is a village of Coimbra. This land is rich in wheat.
Triorae Castle
Quiliano is a village of Guillaumes Castle. This district specializes in the harvest of timber which is floated down the river and sold to nearby towns.
Padenghe Castle
Pizzano is a village of San Giorgio Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Galedum is a village of San Giorgio Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Sant'Angelo Castle
Toritto is a village of Massafra Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
San Brancato
San Brancato is a village of Massafra Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Covasina Castle
Cecina is a village of Bonifacio Castle. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Paganico is a village of Bonifacio Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Langobardia Castle
Scandali is a village of Lombardia Castle. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Dissertina is a village of Mesocco Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Sarnes Castle
Mallnitz is a village of Moosham Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Laurino is a village of Alarcón Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Ancona sits on the coast of the Adriatic Sea, north of the middle Apennine Mountains.
Baiardo is a village of Guillaumes Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Posta is a village of Ancona. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Porziano is a village of Ancona. Sheep graze on the low slopes overlooking the hazy flatlands.
Casoli is a village of Ancona. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Venezia lies on the shallow Venetian Lagoon, surrounded by a group of islands that are separated by expanses of open water and linked by bridges.
Troina is a village of Lombardia Castle. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Baura is a village of Venezia. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Šentrupert
Šentrupert is a village of Venezia. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Monticolum is a village of Venezia. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Palermo sits on the coast of the Tyrrhenian Sea, in northwest Sicily island.
Serra del Falco
Serra del Falco is a village of Palermo. Coastal meadows, where tall grasses tolerant of the ocean salt spray thrive, support the rearing of fine horses.
Cirifarco is a village of Palermo. The villagers here make most of their income from the raising of sheep.
Partanna is a village of Palermo. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Roma sits in the middle of the Italian Peninsula, southwest of the middle Apennine Mountains.
Pontecorvo is a village of Roma. Sheep graze on the low slopes overlooking the hazy flatlands.
Mormanno is a village of Alarcón Castle. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to towns on the coast.
Capannole is a village of Roma. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Napoli sits on the west coast of the southern Italian peninsula.
Cerina is a village of Napoli. Sheep graze on the low slopes overlooking the hazy flatlands.
Pietrapulcina is a village of Napoli. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Carpino is a village of Napoli. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Genova sits on the coast of the Ligurian Sea, near the Apennine Mountains.
Vinca is a village of Genova. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Bovegno is a village of Genova. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Gatinèra
Gatinèra is a village of Mesocco Castle. The grasses on the rolling downs are well-suited to the raising of sheep.
Cagliari sits on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in southern Sardinia island.
Osilo is a village of Cagliari. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Castiadas is a village of Cagliari. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Vrebac is a village of Moosham Castle. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Bergenhus Fortress
Vigmostad is a village of Tunsbergis Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Otta Castle
Hedalen is a village of Mjø Castle. Villagers grow flax in the muddy valleys between the hills in this cold, rainy land.
Örebro Castle
Götafors
Götafors is a village of Läckö Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Rönneshytta
Rönneshytta is a village of Läckö Castle. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Linköping Castle
Hjortkvarn is a village of Stegeborg Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Ismilkorg is a village of Stegeborg Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Mora Castle
Lindesberg is a village of Edsholms Castle. The muddy, low-lying land here is well suited to the growing of flax.
Djurås
Djurås is a village of Edsholms Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Sveg Castle
Rätansbyn
Rätansbyn is a village of Kongsvinger Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Hindsgavl Castle
Uggerby is a village of Kalø Castle. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Mynttornet Castle
Vladiv is a village of Fardume Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Bergen stands in southwestern the Scandinavian Peninsula and west of the southern part of the Scandinavian Mountains, surrounded by mountains.
Vossevangen is a village of Bergen. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Fåberg

Fåberg is a village of Mjø Castle. Though this region is snowbound for much of the year, steppe ponies thrive on the spring grasses and in the winter dig through the snow for food, their thick coats protecting them from the icy blasts of wind.
Matre is a village of Bergen. Today it is known for its daring fishermen, who venture out far to find banks, chilled by currents from the north, that are rich in cod.
Oslo lies on the arc of land at the northernmost end of the Oslofjord, in the southern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Miland is a village of Oslo. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Kvelde is a village of Oslo. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Tandsjöborg
Tandsjöborg is a village of Kongsvinger Castle. Villagers net small spiny perch and crayfish in the streams, drying them for sale to travelers.
Lödöse
Lödöse sits on the coast of the Kattegat, an arm of the North Sea.
Odewall is a village of Göteborg. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Fammarp is a village of Göteborg. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Stockholm sits on the coast of the halych Sea, in the east-southern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Örbyhus
Örbyhus is a village of Stockholm. Villagers here fish for tuna, sardines, bonito, and sharks.
Glavstrom is a village of Fardume Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Nykvarn is a village of Stockholm. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Kungsgården
Kungsgården is a village of Stockholm. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Ornes sits east of the middle Scandinavian Mountains, inland the Scandinavian Peninsula.
Sösjö
Sösjö is a village of Östersund. Snow-bound for much of the year, the spring grasses nonetheless sustain sizeable herds of sheep, the thick wool of which protects them from this land's icy winds.
Bergsjö
Bergsjö is a village of Östersund. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Nørre Broby
Nørre Broby is a village of Kalø Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Örnsköldsvik
Örnsköldsvik sits on the coast of the Gulf of Bothnia, in the eastern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Stugun is a village of Sundsvall. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Sollefteå
Sollefteå is a village of Sundsvall. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Ramvik is a village of Sundsvall. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
Roskilde sits on the eastern coast of the island of Zealand.
Hvallinge is a village of København. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Osby is a village of København. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Engesland is a village of Tunsbergis Castle. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Nalut Castle
Bani Hasan
Bani Hasan is a village of Bani Walid Castle. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Tawrirt Fortress
Zaïo
Zaïo is a village of Gaouz Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Jar Issafen
Jar Issafen is a village of Gaouz Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Amegdul Castle
Shishawah is a village of Essaouira Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Mazighan is a village of Essaouira Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Sfaks Castle
Graïba
Graïba is a village of Younga Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Al Hansha
Al Hansha is a village of Younga Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Souk Ahras Castle
Bled El Anneb
Bled El Anneb is a village of Ain Darahim Castle. The seawinds bring just enough rain to support the cultivation of olive trees.
Tahert Fortress
Faidj is a village of Kaoua Castle. The sides of the hills are terraced to grow wheat, with cisterns to catch the rain blowing up from the sea.
Zagora Fortress
Asfru is a village of Taourirt Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Thar Es-Souk
Thar Es-Souk is a village of Taourirt Castle. The villagers grow olives on the warm, dry landward side of the hills.
al-Araysh Castle
Afrag is a village of Almahdiyya Castle. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Beni Barka Castle
Toujane is a village of Nalut Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Oued Souf
Oued Souf, the name is taken from the local word for river. The town sits southwest of the Salt Lakes Chott Melrhir and Chott Felrhir, watered by an underground river.
Degueche is a village of El Oued. Villagers catch a variety of fish from the salt lake.
Mih Ouansa
Mih Ouansa is a village of El Oued. Villagers sink wells here to tap the groundwater, using it to irrigate their olive groves.
Abu Kammash
Abu Kammash is a village of Bani Walid Castle. The seawinds bring just enough rain to support the cultivation of olive trees.
Babar is a village of El Oued. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Béchar
Béchar sits in the northern Africa. The rocky highlands overlook the town from the east. The west, by contrast, is a flat rocky territory.
Tahert is a village of Kaoua Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Tandrara is a village of Béchar. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
El Ouata
El Ouata is a village of Béchar. Farmland is limited here, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the desert's short-lived but rich spring grasses.
Marrakesh sits in the foothills of the Atlas Mountains, in northwest Africa.
Rahaminah is a village of Marrakech. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Souarekh is a village of Ain Darahim Castle. Coastal meadows, where tall grasses tolerant of the ocean salt spray thrive, support the rearing of fine horses.
Al-Burūj
Al-Burūj is a village of Marrakech. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Tunis sits on the south coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in North Africa.
Zaghouan is a village of Tunis. Though fishing is poor in these parts, villagers have constructed salt pans that stick far out into the shallow waters.
Siliana is a village of Tunis. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Aghdir is a village of Almahdiyya Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Dar Allouch
Dar Allouch is a village of Tunis. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Laghouat sits in the Amour Range of the Saharan Atlas, on the north edge of the Sahara Desert.
Hasi Errmel
Hasi Errmel is a village of Laghouat. Farmland is limited here, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the desert's short-lived but rich spring grasses.
Béni Ounif
Béni Ounif is a village of Laghouat. Farmland is limited here, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the desert's short-lived but rich spring grasses.
Mecif is a village of Laghouat. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Dzayer sits on the south coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in North Africa.
Akerrou is a village of Alger. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Imsouhal is a village of Alger. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Sidi Daoud
Sidi Daoud is a village of Alger. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Zenina is a village of Alger. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Zagora sits in the interior of northwest Africa.
Bir Morra
Bir Morra is a village of Nalut Castle. Farmland is limited here, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the desert's short-lived but rich spring grasses.
Agadir Tissint
Agadir Tissint is a village of Zagora. The surrounding lands, though dry, produce enough grass in the spring to allow the breeding of horses.
Tabalbala is a village of Zagora. Runoff from the hills is trapped underground here, creating springs that sustain an oasis. Wheat thrives in the fields and gardens.
Imzuren is a village of Zagora. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Ribat al-Fath
Ribat al-Fath sits on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean at the mouth of the river Bou Regreg.
Tifelt is a village of Rabat. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Boujniba is a village of Rabat. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling black bass from the lake waters.
Ghadames, known as 'the pearl of the desert', sits in an oasis of North Africa.
El Borma
El Borma is a village of Ghadames. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Sinawin is a village of Ghadames. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Rougemont Castle
Marchia is a village of Château de Sully. Villagers plant olives here on the hillsides.
Gaillard Castle
Saint-Vaize is a village of Château de Saint-Jean-d'Angle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Cauletum is a village of Château de Saint-Jean-d'Angle. This warm land is well-suited to the growing of olive trees.
Éguilly Castle
Essoyes is a village of Château de Lantilly. Villagers net small spiny perch and crayfish in the streams, drying them for sale to travelers.
Hardelot Castle
Guisia is a village of Château d'Hardelot. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Corlay Castle
Plemelin is a village of Château de Quélennec. The level, wetland here is fine for the growing of flax.
Monteneuc is a village of Château de Quélennec. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Raoul Castle
Châtillon-en-Bazois
Châtillon-en-Bazois is a village of Château de la Batisse. The people of this district grow flax on the marshy lands.
Oublanc is a village of Château de la Batisse. Villagers trap fur-bearing animals like marten, rabbits, and foxes.
Arle is a village of Château d'Aumelas. Villagers plant olives here on the hillsides.
Vire Castle
Argentias is a village of Château des Ducs d'Alençon. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Lyon lies on the confluence of the Rhône and Saône rivers, west of the Alps mountains.
Tournus is a village of Lyon. Villagers plant flax in land reclaimed from the riverside marshes.
Champagnole is a village of Lyon. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
N'Arbona is a village of Château d'Aumelas. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Bordèu
Bordeaux sits on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean, near the Garonne river.
Austens is a village of Bordeaux. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to towns on the coast.
Tartas is a village of Bordeaux. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Aginnum is a village of Bordeaux. The people of this district grow flax on the marshy lands.

Lozova is a village of Poltava. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Kerch sits on the coast of the Black Sea in the east of the Crimea Peninsula.
Tcheboksary is a village of Kstovo. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Kirovskoye is a village of Kerch. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Bilmak is a village of Kerch. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, raise sheep in the foothills.
Verkhnii is a village of Kerch. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Kazan lies on the Volga river.
Kanach is a village of Kazan. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, specialize in the rearing of horses.
Bouïnsk
Bouïnsk is a village of Kazan. The villagers, who until recently were nomads, raise sheep known for the long, fine wool.
Kouznetsk is a village of Kazan. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Yashkul is a village of Astrakhan Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.

Tchortkiv is a village of Kamianets-Podilskyi Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.

Tikhvine is a village of Torzhok Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Tver is a village of Torzhok Castle. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Rositten is a village of Vilnia Castle. The villagers trap beaver, marten, and rabbit for their pelts.
Panevėžys
Panevėžys is a village of Vilnia Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.

Mazyr is a village of Mensk Castle. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.

Volodymyr sits north of the Southern Bug river, in the East European Plain.
Salihorsk is a village of Volodymyr. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Krasnystaw is a village of Volodymyr. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Viljandi is a village of Narva Castle. Villagers net small spiny perch and crayfish in the streams, drying them for sale to travelers.
Halych sits north of the Prut river, in the East European Plain.
Lviv is a village of Halych. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Terebovlia is a village of Halych. The villagers set nets in the river to catch a variety of fish.

Mitau is a village of Riga. Villagers net small spiny perch and crayfish in the streams, drying them for sale to travelers.

Rostov Veliki is a village of Moscow Castle. The villagers trap beaver, marten, and rabbit for their pelts.
Ludsen is a village of Riga. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Kokenhusen is a village of Riga. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Polotsk lies on the Daugava river, in the East European Plain.
Hlybokaïe
Hlybokaïe is a village of Polotsk. Snow-bound for much of the year, the spring grasses nonetheless sustain sizeable herds of sheep, the thick wool of which protects them from this land's icy winds.
Choumilina is a village of Polotsk. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Orel is a village of Kozelsk Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.

Velikié Louki
Velikié Louki is a village of Novgorod. The villagers trap beaver, marten, and rabbit for their pelts.
Ladoga is a village of Novgorod. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
Tcherepovets lies on the Sheksna river, which is a tributary of the Volga river.
Voznesenye is a village of Tcherepovets. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling perch, bream, salmon, and occasionally large sturgeon and pike from the lake waters.
Bejetsk is a village of Tcherepovets. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.

Alta is a village of Hammerfest. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.

Trencsén Castle

Trenčín was the seat of the Baron Jakab Cseszneky, who was King Béla IV's swordbearer. Later in the 13-14th century, the castle became the residence of Matthew III Csák, the legendary Lord of the river Váh and the Tatra Mountains.
